page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: HISTORIC BUILDINGS Very few of these are present; the finest is Clifton Hall, built in 1833 by Thomas Clifton, whose family owned the soil from mediaeval times until 1916, on the site of a former hall. Evidence of this can be seen in the cellars which are much older than the hall. Clifton windmill was built in 1785 and is a brick tower mill.Lund church dates back to 1824 and is on the site of an earlier chapel. ANCIENT ROADS The great Roman road running from Ribchester westwards passes through the block through 44 31, 45 31, 46 31 and 47 31;it is all underground and there is little left of it. AGRICULTURE 85% of farming is either dairy or beef, the the remainder is corn, poultry or horticulture.
